Generating Custom Reports from R Shiny Applications and R scripts

Learn how to add custom report generation functionalities within R Shiny applications and how to write R scripts that generate custom reports using rmarkdown
r
shiny
code
automation
rmarkdown
Author

Eli Nimy

Published

July 14, 2024

On this page

  • Parameterised Rmarkdown
  • Generate Report from R shiny

Sometimes, you may need to develop dashboards with limited access or dashboards focused on tracking specific KPIs without providing too much detail. With R Shiny, you can create dashboards that allow users to filter the data they want to see and generate detailed reports or reports tailored for different stakeholders who don’t require access to the full dashboard. Alternatively, you might need an R script integrated into your workflow to automate report generation. In this blog post, we will explore how to create reports from R Shiny filters and R scripts.

In this post, we will primarily explore creating custom HTML reports using an RMarkdown file (.Rmd). Alternatively, you can follow this process using Quarto (.qmd), with output formats of your choosing, such as .docx or .pdf.

Example dataset

We will use the patient admission data from the previous post as an example data set for this post.

Libraries

  • shinyWidgets for the interactive filters and download buttons in the R shiny application

  • rmarkdown for generating the reports.

Parameterised Rmarkdown

When creating an R Shiny application or R script for custom report generation, I usually start by creating a parameterized RMarkdown file. A parameterized report allows you to customize the content dynamically based on input parameters, such as date ranges, filters, or specific variables. This flexibility enables the creation of tailored reports for different users or scenarios, ensuring that each report provides relevant and specific insights.

Creating a parameterised Rmarkdown file

This paramterised .rmd file accepts two parameters admission_date and hospital.

---
title: |
  ![](logo.jpg){width=2.2in}  
  Patient Admission Report
author: "Eli-tech Blog Solutions"
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
output: 
  html_document:
    theme: flatly
params:
  admission_date: !r c(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-01-01"), as.character(Sys.Date()))
  hospital: !r c("Eltech Medical Center", "Bayestry Hospital", "Anival Health Clinic")
---

Filtering data based on parameters

In our case we will be filtering the data based on the input parameters. If no parameter is given from the R shiny application or r script. The default specified parameters will be used. To check if the parameters are returning the given values. The following can executed on the .rmd file or console params$admission_date and params$hospital

# Rmarkdown code chuck (```{r}...```{r})
library(tidyverse)
# Read patient data and filter admission date and hospital 
patient_data <- read_csv("patient_data.csv") |> 
  filter(admission_date >= params$admission_date[1] & 
           admission_date <= params$admission_date[2] & 
           hospital %in% params$hospital)

The code that comes after the above chunk can be your report code that does something with the data or presents certain results. For the complete report refer to this GitHub

Generate Report from R shiny

R shiny filters

These are the r shiny dashboard filters that will be used to generate values for the params in the .Rmd file

# Hospital filter
pickerInput(
  inputId = "hospital",
  label = "Select hospital(s):",
  choices = c("Eltech Medical Center", "Bayestry Hospital", "Anival Health Clinic"),
  multiple = TRUE,
  selected = c("Eltech Medical Center", "Bayestry Hospital", "Anival Health Clinic"),
  options = pickerOptions(
    actionsBox = TRUE,
    size = 5,
    liveSearch = TRUE,
    selectedTextFormat = "count > 1"
  )
)

# Date filter
airDatepickerInput(
  inputId = "admission_date",
  label = "Select admission date range:",
  value = c("2024-01-01", "2024-07-12"),
  range = TRUE,
  separator = " - ",
  minDate = "2024-01-01",
  maxDate = "2024-07-12",
  dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd"
)

R shiny download buttons

This download buttons will be used to trigger the report generation and download

downloadBttn(
  outputId = "patient_admission_report_download",
  label = "Download Report",
  style = "unite",
  size = "sm"
),
downloadBttn(
  outputId = "patient_admission_bulk_report_download",
  label = "Download Multiple Reports",
  style = "unite",
  size = "sm"
)
